title: Panic occurs when initialize dynamicly created vector
body:
I tried this code: ```rust use std::env; use std::arch::asm; fn main() { let mut sp: u64; unsafe { asm!("mov {0}, sp", out (reg) sp); } println!("current sp is {:x}", sp); if let Some(n) = get_arg() { println!("get parameter: {}", n); let mut v = vec![0, n]; my_print(&mut v, n as usize); } } fn my_print(v: &mut [i32], n: usize) { println!("pointer of v is {:p}, len of v is {}", &v, &v.len()); for i in 0..n { v[i] = 0; } } fn get_arg() -> Option { let args: Vec = env::args().collect(); if args.len() > 1 { let need = args[1].parse().unwrap(); Some(need) } else { None } } ``` I expected to see this happen: *run it with parameter 100 and expect it run successfully.* Instead, this happened: *it panic with the following error:* when build in release mode: `current sp is fffff1bb39a0 pointer of v is 0xfffff1bb39a8 thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 2 but the index is 2', src/main.rs:19:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace` when build in debug mode: `current sp is fffff8be0fa0 get parameter: 100 pointer of v is 0xfffff8be0ed8, len of v is 2 thread 'main' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 2 but the index is 2', src/main.rs:20:5 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace ` There are 2 question: 1. why allocate dynamic vector in stack? And in release mode, vector reside in function stack but debug mode not. 2. why the dynamic vector size is 2 no matter what value you give. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.1 (d5a82bbd2 2023-02-07) binary: rustc commit-hash: d5a82bbd26e1ad8b7401f6a718a9c57c96905483 commit-date: 2023-02-07 host: aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.1 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ```
